abstract: A look at one of the entries from last week’s puzzles that stumped our solvers.
lead_paragraph: NEAL Cassady was one of the most prominent members of the Beat literary movement in the 1950s and ’60s, although he never published a book. Instead, he acted as a muse to Beat leaders such as Jack Kerouac and Allen Ginsberg, and appeared as a main character in some of their novels.
